_header: As men are by their qualities / Inclined til diversities
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler TM 203; for extracts see 2298 and 4290.
_description: Andrew Wintoun’s Chronicle of Scotland, in nine books (MSS Edinburgh, National Library of Scotland, Advocates’ 19.2.4 and Edinburgh, Weymyss Castle, Lord Weymyss Wyntoun’s Chronicle , earlier versions, have seven books) — in couplets

BLCottNeroDXI.First Lines: …And drynkes bot watter of þe seQwheþer it salt or byttyr be…
BLCottNeroDXI.Last Lines: …Be preyer consail and ordynaunceDelyuerit to Noude his son & frawns…
BLCottNeroDXI.Note: Begins and ends incomplete; a later marginal annotation indicates the text begins in 1391 and ends 1405.
BLCottNeroDXI.Editions:
Amours,  François Joseph. 
             The Original Chronicle of Andrew of Wyntoun.
             6 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society.
         50, 53-4, 56-7, 63 Edinburgh, London: Blackwood, 1903-14: (with lines 1-64 from Edinburgh,  National Library of Scotland, Advocates’ 19.2.4 and
                        lines 65-686 from Edinburgh,  National Library of Scotland, Advocates’ 19.2.3).
Pinkerton,  John,
                        ed.  
             Ancient Scottish Poems Never Before in Print.
         2 vols. London and Edinburgh, 1786: 2.500-19 (extracts only).
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.162 (extracts only).

BLRoy17Dxx.Editions:
MacPherson,  David,
                        ed.  
             De orygynale cronykil of Scotland.
         London: Bensley, 1795: (selections only).
Laing,  David,
                        ed.  
             The Orygynale Cronykil of Scotland.
         3 vols. Edinburgh: Edmonston and Douglas, 1872-79. 
Eyre-Todd,  George. 
             Early Scottish Poetry.
         Glasgow: W. Hodge, 1891: 144-76 (extracts only).

NLS1923.First Lines:
…ffor all honest det suld beQuyt with
                    possibilite…
NLS1923.Last Lines:
…þai he ressauit rycht bliȝthlyand thankit þe
                    slaares gretusly
NLS1923.Note:
Begins imperfectly in Prologue, line 65; ends imperfectly in Book IX,
                    chap. 10; scribe John Halden.

NLS1924.First Lines:
[As] men ar be þair qualitesInclinit to
                    diuersites…
NLS1924.Last Lines:
…With honour syne Returnit heHayme agayne In his
                    cuntre
NLS1924.Note:
Complete Prologue and 9 Books, with incomplete Table of Contents;
                    Transcript c. 1750 in Brechin Castle,  Earl of Dalhousie Fordun’s Chronicle, on deposit at Edinburgh, Scottish Record Office, MS
            GD5/26/48, pp. 1-835; transcript
                    by Robert Seton in Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library La.III.431 [olim Laing 431], pp. 1-916; (partly transcribed also
                    from Untraced,  Present whereabouts unknown 
               olim Colville).

NLS651.First Lines:
…To sauf our life þat was forlorneBeȝond tyber as I
                    herd tell…
NLS651.Last Lines:
…This Lord the Quik sud in his haleTill his wyff that Lady
                    Cleir…
NLS651.Note:
Begins imperfectly at Book IV, 1.30, and ends imperfectly describing
                    events in Hollond in 1408.

StADA775.First Lines:
…Bot efter þat to prayingIn grec þe lordschip of
                    Archad…
StADA775.Last Lines:
…Witht honour syne retourit heHayme agane in hys
                    cuntre…

Colville.Note:
Partly transcribed: see note to Edinburgh,  National Library of Scotland, Advocates’ 19.2.4
                    version.

Weymyss.First Lines:
…And of þa castis edtyr grewMen and women al of
                    new…
Weymyss.Note:
Begins imperfectly at Book I, lines 65; ends imperfectly; transcript in
                        London,  British Library Harley 6909, ff.1-270.
Weymyss.Editions:
Amours,  François Joseph. 
             The Original Chronicle of Andrew of Wyntoun.
             6 vols.

         50, 53-4, 56-7, 63 Edinburgh, London: Blackwood, 1903-14: (with lines 1-64 from Edinburgh,  National Library of Scotland, Advocates’ 19.2.4 and
